facelet-taglib.description: The Liferay Faces Portal facelet component tags with the portal: tag name prefix.

function.description: Returns an escaped/encoded representation of the specified URL.
Returns the value of the specified portal property name.

tag.description: Captcha is a UIInput that renders Liferay Portal's captcha image and a field for editing single-line text. It provides built-in validation in order to make sure that the text value entered by the user matches the value in the captcha image.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the converter message instead of any message that comes from the registered converter for this component.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: A localized label for this component that is typically only rendered in a FacesMessage when validation fails.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When this flag is true, and a value has not been specified for this component, then the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase will fail and a FacesMessage will be added to the FacesContext for this component.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component when required="true" and no value is selected by the user.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Specifies a custom captcha image URL. If the value is empty (default), then the image will be obtained from Liferay Portal's built-in captcha feature.
attribute.name: url

attribute.description: A method that is executed in the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase of the lifecycle. The method must be public, return void, and take three arguments of FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A method that is executed when the value of this component changes. The method must be public, return void, and take no arguments or one argument of ValueChangeEvent.
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

tag.description: The component is used to display header text by specifying the title attribute. It can also display a clickable back icon.

attribute.description: This value will be used to populate the title attribute of the back icon.
attribute.name: backLabel

attribute.description: The URL of the anchor tag rendered for the back icon. The back icon is not rendered unless this is specified.
attribute.name: backURL

attribute.description: When false, markup will not be escaped. This is true by default.
attribute.name: escapeXml

attribute.description: When false, the back icon is not rendered. The default is true.
attribute.name: showBackURL

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: This value will be used as the header text for the component.
attribute.name: title

tag.description: InputRichText is a UIInput component that renders a field for editing rich text.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Optional map of configuration parameters. For example usage, see the Wiki portlet editor_config.jsp source code.
attribute.name: configParams

attribute.description: The locale (language id) of the rich text content.
attribute.name: contentsLanguageId

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the converter message instead of any message that comes from the registered converter for this component.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: Liferay Portal property key name (typically found in portal.properties or portal-ext.properties). Valid property key values are "ckeditor", "ckeditor_bbcode", and "ckeditor_creole". The default key name is "editor.wysiwyg.default" which has a value of "ckeditor".
attribute.name: editorKey

attribute.description: Optional map of file browser parameters. For example usage, see the Wiki portlet editor_config.jsp source code.
attribute.name: fileBrowserParams

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: A localized label for this component that is typically only rendered in a FacesMessage when validation fails.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: The maximum number of plain text characters, meaning characters that do not include HTML tags such as <strong>, <em>, and <a href="...">.
attribute.name: maxPlainTextChars

attribute.description: The minimum number of plain text characters, meaning characters that do not include HTML tags such as <strong>, <em>, and <a href="...">.
attribute.name: minPlainTextChars

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component's value has changed, and then it loses focus.
attribute.name: onchange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When this flag is true, and a value has not been specified for this component, then the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase will fail and a FacesMessage will be added to the FacesContext for this component.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component when required="true" and no value is selected by the user.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: When true, the will be resizable by the end-user when dragging on the bottom-right resize handle. The default value is true.
attribute.name: resizable

attribute.description: When true, the resources necessary for loading the CKEditor will not be added to the <head>...</head> section of the portal page. The default value is false.
attribute.name: skipEditorLoading

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The name of the set of toolbars that are to be displayed above the rich text input area. Valid values are "bbcode", "creole", "editInPlace", "email", "liferay", "liferayArticle", "phone", "simple", and "tablet". The default value depends on the value of the editorKey attribute. If editorKey's property evaluates to "ckeditor" then the default value is "liferay". If editorKey's property evaluates to "ckeditor_bbcode" then the default value is "bbcode". If editorKey's property evaluates to "ckeditor_creole" then the default value is "creole".
attribute.name: toolbarSet

attribute.description: A method that is executed in the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase of the lifecycle. The method must be public, return void, and take three arguments of FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A method that is executed when the value of this component changes. The method must be public, return void, and take no arguments or one argument of ValueChangeEvent.
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

tag.description: InputSearch is a UIInput component that renders a text field and optional button for submitting search criteria.

attribute.description: A method that is executed when this component is clicked. The method must be public, return an Object, and take no arguments. The toString() method of the returned object is used to determine where to navigate (if at all) after the action has been performed.
attribute.name: action

attribute.description: A method that is executed when this component is clicked. The method must be public, return void, and take either no arguments or one ActionEvent argument.
attribute.name: actionListener

attribute.description: Sets whether the search field gets focus by default. The default value is false.
attribute.name: autoFocus

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: Sets the text value for the search button's label. The default value is Search.
attribute.name: buttonLabel

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Sets the placeholder text for the search field. The default value is the value of the buttonLabel attribute.
attribute.name: placeholder

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: Sets whether to show the search button. The default value is true.
attribute.name: showButton

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: Sets the search box's title.
attribute.name: title

tag.description: Nav is a UIData (iterator) component that renders a <ul>...</ul> (unordered) list. It is designed to be used in conjunction with portal:navItem child component tags.

attribute.description: The WAI-ARIA label which can help users with disabilities when a text label is not visible.
attribute.name: ariaLabel

attribute.description: The WAI-ARIA role which can help users with disabilities understand the purpose of an element, such as whether it is a menu, progress indicator, or some other type of component.
attribute.name: ariaRole

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When true, the unordered list will be surrounded by <div class="collapse nav-collapse">...</div>. This is a responsive layout feature (that works in conjunction with an alloy:navBar parent tag) for small/mobile displays that causes the child alloy:navItem links to be displayed in a popup menu.
attribute.name: responsive

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description:
The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property. The value can be any of the following types:
  • Any concrete subclass of DataModel
  • Array (automatically wrapped with ArrayDataModel)
  • java.util.Collection (automatically wrapped with CollectionDataModel)
  • java.util.List (automatically wrapped with ListDataModel)
  • java.sql.ResultSet (automatically wrapped with ResultSetDataModel)
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be introduced into the EL representing the current iteration.
attribute.name: var

tag.description: NavBar is a UIPanel component that renders a <div>...</div> element. It is designed to be used in conjunction with portal:nav and portal:navItem child component tags.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: NavBarSearch is a UIPanel component that is designed (for CSS purposes) to simply be the parent of an InputSearch component.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

tag.description: NavItem is a UIColumn component that renders an <li>...</li> (list item) element. If the href attribute is specified, then an <a>...</a> anchor tag is rendered inside the list item element.

attribute.description: If the href attribute has a value, then this is the value of the "class" attribute for the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: anchorCssClass

attribute.description: If the href attribute has a value, then this is the child text of the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: anchorData

attribute.description: If the href attribute has a value, then this is the value of the "id" attribute for the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: anchorId

attribute.description: The WAI-ARIA label which can help users with disabilities when a text label is not visible.
attribute.name: ariaLabel

attribute.description: The WAI-ARIA role which can help users with disabilities understand the purpose of an element, such as whether it is a menu, progress indicator, or some other type of component.
attribute.name: ariaRole

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: HTML5 data- attributes for the rendered list item element.
attribute.name: data

attribute.description: The URL of the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element. If not specified, then an anchor tag is not rendered.
attribute.name: href

attribute.description: The name of the CSS class of the icon that is to be rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: iconCssClass

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: The label of the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When true, the list item will be rendered with class="active".
attribute.name: selected

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The title of the anchor tag rendered inside the list item element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: When true, clicking on the href hyperlink will cause the resulting URL to popup in a modal dialog that contains an iframe.
attribute.name: useDialog

tag.description: PermissionsURL is a UIOutput component that generates a URL pointing to the Liferay Portal Permissions UI. If the var attribute is present, the component introduces a variable into the EL. Otherwise, the URL is written to the response.

attribute.description: The Fully-Qualified Class Name (FQCN) of the ServiceBuilder model.
attribute.name: modelResource

attribute.description: The description of the model resource that is to be displayed in the Liferay Portal Permissions UI.
attribute.name: modelResourceDescription

attribute.description: The URL that should be redirected-to when the user clicks on the "Return to Full Page" link in the Liferay Portal Permissions UI.
attribute.name: redirect

attribute.description: The scope group id for the resource. The default value is LiferayFacesContext.getInstance().getScopeGroupId()
attribute.name: resourceGroupId

attribute.description: The primary key used to identify the resource.
attribute.name: resourcePrimKey

attribute.description: An array of type int that corresponds to the roles that are to be displayed in the Liferay Portal Permissions UI. For more info, see com.liferay.portal.model.RoleConstants.
attribute.name: roleTypes

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be introduced into the EL that contains the value of the generated permissions URL. If not specified, then the generated permissions URL is written directly to the response.
attribute.name: var

attribute.description: The portlet window state for which the Liferay Portal Permissions UI should be displayed. Valid values include: "maximized", "pop_up", and "exclusive". The default value is "maximized".
attribute.name: windowState

tag.description: Runtime is a UIPanel component that embeds the markup of a different portlet within the current portlet.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: XML markup in the form <preferences><preference><name></name><value></value></preference></preferences>. This value is persisted in the Liferay database when the embedded portlet is rendered for the first time.
attribute.name: defaultPreferences

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: The name of the portlet. For out-of-the-box portlets, refer to the portlet-name element of the liferay-portlet.xml descriptor.
attribute.name: portletName

attribute.description: Optional query string parameters that will be added to the request dispatcher that invokes the portlet's RENDER_PHASE.
attribute.name: queryString

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: List of CSS class names (separated by spaces) that are to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass
